title: I’m not sure if I should tell my boyfriend I’m struggling with anxiety
self_text: Hi Reddit, I'm a 24-year-old female and I’ve been struggling with anxiety for a long time, but it’s gotten significantly worse recently. I’ve been seeing a therapist and taking medication, but I still have really bad panic attacks and generalized anxiety. I’ve been dating my boyfriend, Mark, for about 6 months, and he’s incredibly supportive and understanding. However, I’m hesitant to tell him because I’m afraid he’ll think I’m unstable or that he won’t be able to cope with it. I want to be open with him, but I also don’t want to burden him with my struggles. What are your thoughts? Should I tell him, and if so, how should I approach the conversation?

title: AITA for letting my ex have custody of my child
self_text: I'm a single parent of a 6 year old child. I separated with my ex about 3 years ago. We have joint custody and visitation. Until recently, everything has been pretty smooth sailing. My ex has always been a responsible parent, and I've never had any concerns about his ability to care for our child. However, he's recently been exhibiting some concerning behaviors. He's been excessively permissive with our child, allowing him to stay up late, eat junk food, and skip chores. He also seems to be isolating our child from his friends and family. I've expressed my concerns to him multiple times, but he dismisses them as me being overly controlling and trying to undermine his authority. Despite my repeated attempts to communicate constructively, he continues to disregard my feedback and maintain his current parenting style. Recently, I filed a motion with the court requesting modifications to the custody agreement to address these concerns, outlining specific examples of his problematic behavior. My ex vehemently opposes the motion and claims that I'm attempting to sabotage his role as a father. The judge has scheduled a hearing next month to discuss the matter. I believe it's crucial to protect my child's well-being, but I'm worried that my ex's resistance will make it difficult to achieve a favorable outcome. Given the situation, AITA for seeking modifications to the custody agreement?

title: AITA for throwing away my grandmother's belongings?
self_text: I (26F) moved to my grandmother's house back on 2020. For context, the house was bought by my parents when we moved states over 20 years ago, but after a nasty fight, my grandma refused to move out so my parents, sister and I moved instead, and she kept living there. Recently my grandma (88F) could no longer live on her own, so my mother took her in and I moved here.   My grandma is a bit of a hoarder. She had boxes full of decades old stuff that had not seen the light of day in years. When she moved to my mom's, I was left to sort the bulk of it out. However, I would defer to her before throwing or giving away anything. She has very bad memory and sometimes denied I ever asked her, so I kept some items in case she changed her mind.  She also had a car that she rarely used and I kept it after she could no longer drive. I spent a lot of money trying to get it back in shape, but it bled me out if my savings with constant new repairs, so it was sold with her blessing, and she told me to keep the money.   All of this happened a year ago. Yesterday I brought her the last of her stuff, and today she called me to ask about some missing books, and when I told her that I did give them away, she started crying, accusing me of not appreciating any of that stuff, and bringing up how I should have insisted more on her keeping some of the money.   I feel like I should have insisted more, or at least attempted to keep some stuff because, in reality, it was part of her history and may have had more sentimental value than what we thought.   So Reddit, AITA?

title: I’m not sure if I’m overreacting
self_text: Okay, so I’ve been seeing someone for about six months, and things have been going really well. We have a lot in common, we laugh a lot, and we genuinely enjoy each other’s company. Lately, though, he's been canceling plans at the last minute, saying he's "busy," but when I ask what he's busy with, he deflects or gives vague answers. He's also been increasingly unavailable via text and phone. Last night, he canceled on me again, saying he had a last-minute work thing. I confronted him about the pattern of cancellations, and he brushed it off, saying he just needs some space and that I'm being too needy. I'm starting to feel incredibly insecure and anxious about the relationship. I'm constantly questioning whether he still cares about me and worrying that he's losing interest. I know I shouldn’t jump to conclusions, but it's hard not to feel like I'm being strung along. Has anyone experienced something similar? How did you navigate it?

title: Should I forgive my ex for lying to me

However, lately, he’s been constantly borrowing my clothes without asking. It’s not a huge deal individually, but it’s happening almost every week. I’ve politely asked him to ask me before borrowing things in the past, but he brushes it off and says he just assumed it was okay. I don't want to create conflict, but I'm starting to feel like my boundaries are being disregarded. How can I address this situation with Liam in a constructive way without escalating the tension?

title: My ex is harassing me
self_text: Okay, so I broke up with my ex about six months ago. Things were really bad, and I filed a restraining order against him. It was upheld and lasted for a year. It expired a month ago, and I thought we were over it. However, he’s been sending me increasingly disturbing messages – threats, stalking my location, and generally making my life miserable. I reported it to the police, but they said they can’t do anything unless he physically harms me or violates the terms of the restraining order. I'm terrified and don't know what to do. I feel trapped and helpless.

title: My ex is harassing me via text
self_text: Okay so, I broke up with my ex a few weeks ago. We hadn't been getting along for a while and I decided to end it. Things were amicable, we agreed to be friends, but he's been sending me increasingly unsettling texts. Nothing overtly threatening, but things like "I know you're lying about..." or "Remember when..." and just generally trying to make me feel uncomfortable. It started a week after the breakup, and it’s escalated over the past few days. He’s not answering my calls and blocking me on social media. I’ve reported the texts to my carrier, but I’m worried about escalating things further. I’m starting to feel unsafe and anxious. Should I involve the police?

title: I’m so confused about my boyfriend’s family
self_text: Okay, so I’ve been dating my boyfriend (28M) for six months. Things are going really well, we have a lot in common, and I genuinely enjoy spending time with him. However, I’m increasingly uncomfortable with his family. His mom (60sF) is incredibly critical and judgmental – she constantly offers unsolicited advice, nitpicks everything I do, and generally makes me feel like an outsider. His dad (65M) is quiet but equally unsettling; he avoids eye contact and seems to disapprove of me. They both seem to subtly exclude me from conversations and activities, making me feel like I don't belong.  His siblings are slightly better, but they often echo their parents' sentiments. I’ve tried to be welcoming and polite, but it feels like a constant battle to maintain my composure. I’m starting to dread family gatherings and I’m worried about how this will impact our relationship. I want to be supportive of his family, but I don't want to sacrifice my own happiness and wellbeing. I've discussed it with him a few times, and he acknowledges their behavior but says they're "just like that" and that it's "not a big deal." He claims they'll eventually warm up to me, but it's been six months, and I'm starting to lose hope. I'm wondering if I should set firmer boundaries, or if I’m overreacting and focusing too much on his family's disapproval. Has anyone dealt with a similar situation? How did you navigate it?

title: I hate my boyfriend's mom
self_text: My boyfriend and I have been dating for about 6 months, and I'm starting to really like him. However, I absolutely *hate* his mom. She’s incredibly judgmental, critical, and constantly undermines my relationship with him. She makes passive-aggressive comments about me, tries to steer him away from me, and generally makes me feel unwelcome in his life. How do I deal with this situation without jeopardizing

This is creating a stressful and unhealthy living environment for me, and it’s significantly impacting my mental health. I’m constantly irritated, anxious, and feeling overwhelmed. title: AITA for leaving with my daughter on thanksgiving dinner and telling her mom she’s insecure?
self_text: I had my daughter when I was really young and I’ve raised her since she was little when her mom gave her up.   She’s 14 her mom reached out to me asking for her to come with her and with my daughters okay she went over, second time she’s met her.   They Invited me as well but I wasn’t interested in going, but my daughter didn’t want to go alone.  When we did go at first everyone was Inviting her grandparents welcomed my daughter quickly and started asking her questions and at first it was okay.   it’s relevant to know that my kid isnt fat, she’s not even over weight period   there was a lot of people so there was a lot of food to eat, my daughter was making a plate when her mom came over specifically to tell her to not put to many rolls on her plate. I reacted maybe they just needed to save some for the guests and I had no idea what it was about,  Second times was when her mom walked over again and made her put back food, told her that she didn’t really didn’t need to eat so much and made her her plate, with actually very little and three out of the 11 things they had made. I grabbed her jacket and said okay let’s go. Thanked everyone for the food. Her mom got mad that I was leaving and said that I was being over dramatic about this. I told my daughter to go to the car and when she left I said that she was so fucking ridiculous to tell that to a fourteen year old and just because she was overweight doesn’t give her any damn right to project her insecurities onto my kid.   She ignored that and said that I can’t get it into my head that it’s our kid. I said that the fact that she just ignored me telling her she’s hurting her kid shows me she isn’t ready to have her in her life.   I’m told that leaving like that was wrong and bringing up her weight was a low blow, and that I should have just clarified to my daughter it was okay to eat it.  Edit:  Hi! Your daughter needs to learn how to eat in moderation, she needs to be taught to serve a little bit of food at a time, finish it and wait a little bit more to see if she’s still hungry before getting more. Piling up her plate with food isn’t a good habit   a message I just received from a lady who has  messaged me about my daughter without even reading the post. She ate it all, and didn’t get a chance to make her plate because it was taken. Still ate it all, and asked for more. Please read and comprehend before moving forward.

self_text: I had my daughter when I was really young and I’ve raised her since she was little when her mom gave her up.   She’s 14 her mom reached out to me asking for her to come with her and with my daughters okay she went over, second time she’s met her.   They Invited me as well but I wasn’t interested in going, but my daughter didn’t want to go alone.  When we did go at first everyone was Inviting her grandparents welcomed my daughter quickly and started asking her questions and at first it was okay.   it’s relevant to know that my kid isnt fat, she’s not even over weight period   there was a lot of people so there was a lot of food to eat, my daughter was making a plate when her mom came over specifically to tell her to not put to many rolls on her plate. I said that she usually eats it and if wasted food was an issue we will always take whatever she didn’t eat home and she eats it then, I was trying to be the most open minded and that this was just tone deaf.  When we had sat down my daughter ate everything on her plate and her mom stopped her and said no “don’t go grab anymore because she will get  more  ….. bloated    I told her to get some if she will finish it, and told her mom to not say stuff like that to my daughter and don’t make her try to worry about her weight that’s not a concern to anyone but her doctor.   Last straw was when I went to the bathroom and came out to see her trying to take my daughters plate away and throw it out telling her that she didn’t need anymore food and to just listen when someone says stop eating.   I walked over and grabbed both of our jackets and said okay let’s go. Thanked everyone for the food. Her mom got mad that I was leaving and said that I was being over dramatic about this. title: I'm not sure if I should cut ties with my boyfriend
self_text: I (29F) have been dating my boyfriend (31M) for 2 years. We've had our ups and downs, but generally have a good relationship. Lately, I've noticed he's been increasingly dismissive of my feelings and concerns. He tends to invalidate my emotions, offering solutions instead of empathy, and often shuts down conversations when I try to discuss deeper issues. I've expressed this to him multiple times, explaining how it makes me feel, but he brushes it off, saying he doesn't understand why I'm so sensitive or that I'm overreacting. Despite this, he continues to behave this way, and I'm starting to feel emotionally drained and unheard. I'm considering ending the relationship, but I'm conflicted because I still care about him and enjoy aspects of our time together. However, I don't want to continue sacrificing my emotional wellbeing for a relationship that leaves me feeling undervalued and unsupported. I'm wondering if this is a pattern he'll continue to exhibit, and if investing further in the relationship will ultimately lead to more unhappiness.  Has anyone experienced similar dynamics and navigated them successfully, or do you think it's time for me to prioritize my own happiness and move on?

title: AITA for throwing away my grandmother's belongings?
self_text: I (26F) moved to my grandmother's house back on 2020. For context, the house was bought by my parents when we moved states over 20 years ago, but after a nasty fight, my grandma refused to move out so my parents, sister and I moved instead, and she kept living there. Recently my grandma (88F) could no longer live on her own, so my mother took her in and I moved here.   My grandma is a bit of a hoarder. She had boxes full of decades old stuff that had not seen the light of day in years. When she moved to my mom's, I was left to sort the bulk of it out. However, I would defer to her before throwing or giving away anything. She has very bad memory and sometimes denied I ever asked her, so I kept some items in case she changed her mind.   She also had a car that she barely used and I kept it after she could no longer drive. I spent a lot of money trying to get it back in shape, but it bled me out if my savings with constant new repairs, so it was sold with her blessing, and she told me to keep the money.   All of this happened a year ago. Yesterday I brought her the last of her stuff, and today she called me to ask about some missing books, and when I told her that I did give them away, she started crying, accusing me of not appreciating any of that stuff, and bringing up how I should have insisted more on her keeping some of the money.   I feel guilty. My mother said I shouldn't worry because I did nothing wrong, and my grandma has to learn to let go of things she no longer uses. However, I feel like I should have insisted more, or at least attempted to keep some stuff because, in reality, it was part of her history and may have had more sentimental value than what we thought.   So Reddit, AITA?

title: My ex is harassing me.
self_text: I’m not sure where to begin. I ended a 3 year relationship approximately 6 months ago and I’ve been receiving threatening messages and emails from my ex. He’s telling me that he misses me, that he’s suffered, that he regrets everything and that if I don’t reconcile with him, he will reveal deeply personal information about me to my family and friends. He's sending me photos of me and telling me to come to his place, which I won't do. I've reported the messages to my local police department and they advised me to obtain a restraining order. I'm terrified and incredibly anxious. I’ve changed my phone number and email address, but he’s figured out how to contact me through social media. I'm starting to feel trapped and unsafe. I don’t know what to do. I have been seeking legal counsel, but it is expensive and I don't know if I can afford it. Should I continue to pursue a restraining order? What steps can I take to protect myself?

title: I'm not sure if I should tell my boyfriend about my anxieties
self_text: I've been struggling with anxiety for a long time, and it's been getting progressively worse recently. I’m starting to feel like it's impacting my ability to function normally, and I'm worried about how it's affecting my relationship. I’m hesitant to tell my boyfriend because I’m afraid he’ll think I’m unstable or that it will create tension between us. However, I also believe that honesty and vulnerability are crucial for a healthy relationship, and I don’t want to keep bottling up my feelings. I'm not sure how to initiate the conversation or what to expect his reaction to be.

title: AITA for leaving with my daughter on thanksgiving dinner and telling her mom she’s insecure?
self_text: I had my daughter when I was really young and I’ve raised her since she was little when her mom gave her up.   She’s 14 her mom reached out to me asking for her to come with her and with my daughters okay she went over, second time she’s met her.   They Invited me as well but I wasn’t interested in going, but my daughter didn’t want to go alone.  When we did go at first everyone was Inviting her grandparents welcomed my daughter quickly and started asking her questions and at first it was okay.   it’s relevant to know that my kid isnt fat, she’s not even over weight period   there was a lot of people so there was a lot of food to eat, my daughter was making a plate when her mom came over specifically to tell her to not put to many rolls on her plate. I reacted maybe they just needed to save some for the guests and I had no idea what it was about,  Second times was when her mom walked over again and made her put back food, told her that she didn’t really didn’t need to eat so much and made her her plate, with actually very little and three out of the 11 things they had made. I pulled her aside and asked her if there was a reason she was doing this so I could inform my daughter but she said no of course not they made plenty and she was just helping her because there was too much on the plate.  I said that she usually eats it and if wasted food was an issue we will always take whatever she didn’t eat home and she eats it then, I was trying to be the most open minded and that this was just tone deaf.   When we had sat down my daughter ate everything on her plate and her mom stopped her and said no “don’t go grab anymore because she will get  more  ….. bloated    I told her to get some if she will finish it, and told her mom to not say stuff like that to my daughter and don’t make her try to worry about her weight that’s not a concern to anyone but her doctor.   Last straw was when I went to the bathroom and came out to see her trying to take my daughters plate away and throw it out telling her that she didn’t need anymore food and to just listen when someone says stop eating.   I walked over and grabbed both of our jackets and said okay let’s go. Thanked everyone for the food. Her mom got mad that I was leaving and said that I was being over dramatic about this. I said that she was so fucking ridiculous to tell that to a fourteen year old and just because she was overweight doesn’t give her any damn right to project her insecurities onto my kid.   She ignored that and said that I can’t get it into my head that it’s our kid. I said that the fact that she just ignored me telling her she’s hurting her kid shows me she isn’t ready to have her in her life.   I’m told that leaving like that was wrong and bringing up her weight was a low blow, and that I should have just clarified to my daughter it was okay to eat it.  Edit:  Hi! Your daughter needs to learn how to eat in moderation, she needs to be taught to serve a little bit of food at a time, finish it and wait a little bit more to see if she’s still hungry before getting more. Piling up her plate with food isn’t a good habit   a message I just received from a lady who has  messaged me about my daughter without even reading the post. She ate it all, and didn’t get a chance to make her plate because it was taken. Please read and comprehend before moving forward.

title: I'm not sure if I should tell my girlfriend I'm attracted to someone else
self_text: Hi, I'm 25 and I've been dating my girlfriend, Sarah, for about a year. We have a really good relationship and I generally enjoy being with her. However, lately I've started developing feelings for someone else – a colleague named Emily. It's just a passing attraction, and I'm definitely not planning on acting on it, but it's becoming increasingly difficult to ignore. I'm worried about telling Sarah, as I don't want to jeopardize our relationship. On the other hand, I feel like honesty is important in a relationship, and suppressing these feelings could lead to resentment down the line. What should I do?

title: I'm not sure if I should dump my boyfriend
self_text: I (26F) have been dating my boyfriend (28M) for 3 years. We have a lot of fun together, we're good at communicating, and we generally make each other happy. However, lately I’ve been feeling increasingly suffocated by him. He tends to be overly possessive and controlling, constantly checking up on me, questioning my whereabouts, and getting upset when I spend time with my friends. It started subtly, but it's escalating. Lately, he's been monitoring my social media, demanding to see my messages, and accusing me of flirting with other guys. It’s making me feel trapped and like I’m losing my independence. I've tried talking to him about it, explaining how his behavior makes me uncomfortable and anxious, but he dismisses my concerns, saying I'm being paranoid and insecure, and that he’s just caring about me. He says he loves me and wants to protect me, but his actions are actually isolating me from my support system and eroding my self-esteem. I’m starting to wonder if this is a sign of a deeper issue, possibly even some underlying jealousy or insecurity on his part. I'm torn – I still care about him and cherish our shared history, but I can't continue to live in a relationship where I feel controlled and stifled. I don’t want to ruin things unnecessarily, but I also don’t want to sacrifice my happiness and wellbeing. Has anyone experienced something similar? What advice would you give me?

title: AITA for letting my dog poop on the neighbor’s lawn
self_text: My dog is a golden retriever and he is constantly running loose. We live on a street with shared grassy areas. The other day, he ran across the neighbor’s lawn and pooped. I cleaned it up immediately with a shovel and bag, but the neighbor confronted me and was furious. She said she’s been warning us about letting him run loose and that we need to clean up after him. I told her I’d clean it up, but she said it’s not enough and that we need to keep him contained. I argued that he’s just a playful dog and enjoys exploring. She threatened to call animal control if it happened again. I’m not thrilled with her yelling, but I don’t think we’re entirely in the wrong. What do you think?

title: AITA for throwing away my grandmother's belongings?
self_text: I (26F) moved to my grandmother's house back on 2020. For context, the house was bought by my parents when we moved states over 20 years ago, but after a nasty fight, my grandma refused to move out so my parents, sister and I moved instead, and she kept living there. Recently my grandma (88F) could no longer live on her own, so my mother took her in and I moved here.   My grandma is a bit of a hoarder. She had boxes full of decades old stuff that had not seen the light of day in years. When she moved to my mom's, I was left to sort the bulk of it out. However, I would defer to her before throwing or giving away anything. She has very bad memory and sometimes denied I ever asked her, so I kept some items in case she changed her mind.   She also had a car that she rarely used and I kept it after she could no longer drive. I spent a lot of money trying to get it back in shape, but it bled me out if my savings with constant new repairs, so it was sold with her blessing, and she told me to keep the money.   All of this happened a year ago. Yesterday I brought her the last of her stuff, and today she called me to ask about some missing books, and when I told her that I did give them away, she started crying, accusing me of not appreciating any of that stuff, and bringing up how I should have insisted more on keeping some of the money.   I feel like I should have insisted more, or at least attempted to keep some stuff because, in reality, it was part of her history and may have had more sentimental value than what we thought.   So Reddit, AITA?

title: My mum wants me to donate my sperm
self_text: My mum is pressing me to donate my sperm. She says she wants grandchildren, and she wants me to be the one to give them to her. I'm not interested in having children, and frankly, I don’t want to be involved in this at all. She keeps saying that she's aging and that she doesn't want to regret not having kids, and that I owe it to her to fulfill her dreams. She's been subtly hinting and dropping hints for months, and now she's outright demanding it. I've politely declined repeatedly, explaining that it's not something I want, but she refuses to accept it. She says that it's my responsibility as a son and that I'm being selfish. She's threatening to cut me out of her will if I don't comply. I feel incredibly pressured and manipulated. What should I do?

title: My ex just posted a photo of her with someone new.
self_text: Okay, this is incredibly painful. My ex (30F) and I broke up six months ago after four years together. It was amicable, we both agreed we weren't compatible long-term, and we've remained friends. However, I've been slowly healing and moving on, focusing on myself and my career. Today, I saw her posted a photo on Instagram with a guy – he looks like he’s in his late 20s, handsome, and seems really smitten with her. The caption reads, "Amazing night with [guy's name]." I know she's trying to move on, and honestly, I'm happy for her, truly. But seeing it, seeing *him*, just punched me in the gut. I immediately unfollowed her, but I'm still obsessing over it. It feels like a deliberate attempt to hurt me, even though I know it's probably not. I'm trying to distract myself, but it's impossible. What do I do?

title: My ex just started following me on Instagram
self_text: Hi! I'm not sure if this is the right place to ask, but my ex (who we broke up with 6 months ago) just started following me on Instagram. We broke up because he said he needed space, and I've been respecting that boundary and haven't reached out. I'm trying to move on, but seeing him online is definitely making it harder. I'm not sure if it's a coincidence, or if he's deliberately trying to check up on me. Should I block him, or just ignore it?

title: My mum wants to be a bridesmaid
self_text: I am 25, and my mum is 50. She has never been married and has never had children. She recently told me she wants to be a bridesmaid in my upcoming wedding. I’m incredibly happy that she wants to be involved, but I’m also deeply uncomfortable with the idea. I think it’s presumptuous of her, and frankly, I don't want her to be a bridesmaid. I'm worried about how she'll react if I decline and I don't want to ruin our relationship.  She's always been a bit controlling and has a tendency to insert herself into my life where she's not welcome. I’m worried this would escalate things. I'm also not entirely sure if she'd even *want* to be a bridesmaid – she’s never been particularly involved in weddings before. I don’t want to hurt her feelings, but I also need to protect my own boundaries. How should I navigate this delicately?

Last straw was when I went to the bathroom and came out to see her trying to take my daughters plate away and throw it out telling her that she didn’t need anymore food and to just listen when someone says stop eating.   I walked over and grabbed both of our jackets and said okay let’s go. Thanked everyone for the food. Her mom got mad that I was leaving and said that I was being over dramatic about this. I told my daughter to go to the car and when she left I said that she was so fucking ridiculous to tell that to a fourteen year old and just because she was overweight doesn’t give her any damn right to project her insecurities onto my kid.   She ignored that and said that I can’t get it into my head that it’s our kid. I said that the fact that she just ignored me telling her she’s hurting her kid shows me she isn’t ready to have her in her life.   I’m told that leaving like that was wrong and bringing up her weight was a low blow, and that I should have just clarified to my daughter it was okay to eat it.  Edit:  Hi! Your daughter needs to learn how to eat in moderation, she needs to be taught to serve a little bit of food at a time, finish it and wait a little bit more to see if she’s still hungry before getting more. Piling up her plate with food isn’t a good habit   a message I just received from a lady who has  messaged me about my daughter without even reading the post. She ate it all, and didn’t get a chance to make her plate because it was taken. Please read and comprehend before moving forward.

title: I’m not sure if I should tell my partner about my past
self_text: I’ve been dating my partner for 6 months and we’re really happy. I have a history of unhealthy relationships and some past traumas that I’ve never really shared with anyone. I’m worried about how he’ll react if he knows, and honestly, I’m scared of being vulnerable. On the other hand, I think honesty is important in a relationship, and I want to build a solid foundation of trust. What do you guys think? Should I tell him, or wait until I’m more comfortable?

title: My ex is constantly messaging me
self_text: I broke up with my ex about 6 months ago. We had a really tough breakup and it was painful for both of us. Since then, he’s been constantly messaging me – almost daily. He starts off casual, talking about his day, but then gradually becomes more intense, reminiscing about the past, and expressing how he misses me. I've firmly told him I’m not interested in revisiting the relationship and that I need him to respect my boundaries. He continues to do this. I've blocked him on social media, but he finds ways to contact me through mutual friends. I'm starting to feel harassed and incredibly anxious. How do I effectively protect myself and make it clear that I want zero contact?

title: My wife is engaging with a guy she met at the gym
self_text: My wife (31F) and I (33M) have been married for 5 years. Lately, she’s been going to the gym more frequently and has started spending a significant amount of time chatting with a guy (28M) who works out there. She says he's a good listener and they connect on a lot of things. I've noticed she's been more secretive about her workouts – changing her routine, arriving earlier or later, and generally being vague about what she's doing.  Yesterday, I caught her on the phone, whispering and giggling, and when I asked who she was talking to, she quickly said it was "just a guy at the gym." I’m not accusing her of anything, but I'm feeling insecure and anxious. I’ve asked her directly if she's developing feelings for him, and she denied it vehemently, saying she only enjoys his company as a friend. However, her behavior continues to be evasive and she avoids discussing it.  I don't want to be controlling or distrustful, but I also don't want to ignore my concerns.  Should I continue to gently probe the situation, or is there a more constructive way to address my feelings of insecurity?

title: AITA for leaving with my daughter on thanksgiving dinner and telling her mom she’s insecure?
self_text: I had my daughter when I was really young and I’ve raised her since she was little when her mom gave her up.   She’s 14 her mom reached out to me asking for her to come with her and with my daughters okay she went over, second time she’s met her.   They Invited me as well but I wasn’t interested in going, but my daughter didn’t want to go alone.  When we did go at first everyone was Inviting her grandparents welcomed my daughter quickly and started asking her questions and at first it was okay.   it’s relevant to know that my kid isnt fat, she’s not even over weight period   there was a lot of people so there was a lot of food to eat, my daughter was making a plate when her mom came over specifically to tell her to not put to many rolls on her plate. I reacted maybe they just needed to save some for the guests and I had no idea what it was about,  Second times was when her mom walked over again and made her put back food, told her that she didn’t really didn’t need to eat so much and made her her plate, with actually very little and three out of the 11 things they had made. I pulled her aside and asked her if there was a reason she was doing this so I could inform my daughter but she said no of course not they made plenty and she was just helping her because there was too much on the plate.  I said that she usually eats it and if wasted food was an issue we will always take whatever she didn’t eat home and she eats it then, I was trying to be the most open minded and that this was just tone deaf.   When we had sat down my daughter ate everything on her plate and her mom stopped her and said no “don’t go grab anymore because she will get  more  ….. bloated    I told her to get some if she will finish it, and told her mom to not say stuff like that to my daughter and don’t make her try to worry about her weight that’s not a concern to anyone but her doctor.   Last straw was when I went to the bathroom and came out to see her trying to take my daughters plate away and throw it out telling her that she didn’t need anymore food and to just listen when someone says stop eating.   I walked over and grabbed both of our jackets and said okay let’s go. Thanked everyone for the food. Her mom got mad that I was leaving and said that I was being over dramatic about this. I told my daughter to go to the car and when she left I said that she was so fucking ridiculous to tell that to a fourteen year old and just because she was overweight doesn’t give her any damn right to project her insecurities onto my kid.   She ignored that and said that I can’t get it into my head that it’s our kid. I said that the fact that she just ignored me telling her she’s hurting her kid shows me she isn’t ready to have her in her life.   I’m told that leaving like that was wrong and bringing up her weight was a low blow, and that I should have just clarified to my daughter it was okay to eat it.  Edit:  Hi! Your daughter needs to learn how to eat in moderation, she needs to be taught to serve a little bit of food at a time, finish it and wait a little bit more to see if she’s still hungry before getting more. Piling up her plate with food isn’t a good habit   a message I just received from a lady who has  messaged me about my daughter without even reading the post. She ate it all, and didn’t get a chance to make her plate because it was taken. Please read and comprehend before moving forward.

title: AITA for letting my roommate borrow my clothes
self_text: My roommate (22M) has been having some financial struggles lately and asked if he could borrow some of my clothes to wear to a job interview. I initially said no, but he argued that he didn't have anything suitable and that it was a really important interview. I reluctantly agreed, but only if he returns them clean within 24 hours. He wore them to the interview and returned them dirty, stained with spaghetti sauce. I'm understandably upset because I don't want my clothes ruined and I feel like he disregarded my boundaries.

title: I’m afraid to lose my girlfriend
self_text: I (26M) have been dating my girlfriend (25F) for 6 months. We have a great connection and enjoy spending time together. Lately, I've become increasingly anxious about the possibility of her leaving me. I find myself obsessively checking for signs of dissatisfaction, analyzing her behavior, and worrying about trivial things she might say or do. It's impacting my daily life and happiness. I've tried to communicate my concerns to her, but she brushes them off, saying I'm being paranoid. I’m struggling to cope with these anxieties and would appreciate any advice on how to manage them and build greater security in the relationship.

title: I’m not sure if I’m overreacting
self_text: I'm trying to decide if I'm overreacting to my girlfriend's behavior regarding her ex.  We've been together for six months, and she has an ex that she's still very fond of.  She doesn't talk about him much, but I've noticed she still checks his social media occasionally and seems wistful when she sees pictures of him.  She also occasionally brings up memories of their time together, which makes me uncomfortable.  I've gently expressed that I'm not comfortable with her dwelling on the past, but she brushed it off and said she just misses him sometimes.  I'm starting to feel like she's not fully invested in our relationship and that she's holding onto something from her previous relationship.  Am I being unreasonable to feel this way, or is it valid to want her to move on completely?

title: AITA for throwing away my grandmother’s belongings?
self_text: I (26F) moved to my grandmother’s house back on 2020. For context, the house was bought by my parents when we moved states over 20 years ago, but after a nasty fight, my grandma refused to move out so my parents, sister and I moved instead, and she kept living there. Recently my grandma (88F) could no longer live on her own, so my mother took her in and I moved here.   My grandma is a bit of a hoarder. She had boxes full of decades old stuff that had not seen the light of day in years. When she moved to my mom’s, I was left to sort the bulk of it out. However, I would defer to her before throwing or giving away anything. She has very bad memory and sometimes denied I ever asked her, so I kept some items in case she changed her mind.  She also had a car that she barely used and I kept it after she could no longer drive. I spent a lot of money trying to get it back in shape, but it bled me out if my savings with constant new repairs, so it was sold with her blessing, and she told me to keep the money.   All of this happened a year ago. Yesterday I brought her the last of her stuff, and today she called me to ask about some missing books, and when I told her that I did give them away, she started crying, accusing me of not appreciating any of that stuff, and bringing up how I should have “insisted” more on keeping some of the money.   So Reddit, AITA?

title: I'm not sure if I should continue to date my ex
self_text: I broke up with my ex-boyfriend six months ago. We were together for three years and it was a really tough breakup. We both agreed it was best to move on, but I still have feelings for him. About two months ago, we started casually hanging out again – just as friends. It's been really nice reconnecting, and I genuinely enjoy spending time with him. However, I'm starting to realize that I might still have romantic feelings for him, and I'm worried about jeopardizing our friendship if I pursue anything more. I'm also afraid of getting hurt again. What should I do?
